availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert T. Potter (Warren County, Kentucky, constable )

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, constable. Kentucky native. Son of Lewis Potter and Elizabeth Potter. Resident in Warren County, Kentucky in 1850. Constable in Warren County, Kentucky in 1860. Nominated as constable for Warren County, Kentucky in December 1861 at Provisional Government of the State of Kentucky session.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 801.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 244.
Find A Grave, "Albert T. Potter (September 18, 1833-September 28, 1873)," Memorial #88556260, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88556260 (accessed January 25, 2020).
KYR-0004-033-0030.
